channel.title: Unix on Random Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Unix on Random Notes

item.description: NetBSD Installation Notes Preparing the USB drive (to use CD sets for full install..) => dd if=/dir/NetBSD-(version)-amd64-install.img of=/dev/sdX bs=8M; sync Preparing Wifi Access => vi /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf ++ network={ ++ ssid="yourssid" ++ scan_ssid=1 ++ key_mgmt=WPA-PSK ++ psk="yourpsk" ++ } => vi /etc/rc.conf ++ dhcpcd_flags="-q -b" ++ wpa_supplicant="YES" ++ wpa_supplicant_flags="-B -i ath0 -c /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf" => vi /etc/ifconfig.ath0 ++ up ++ dhcp => /etc/rc.d/wpa_supplicant start => /etc/rc.d/network restart => http://wiki.netbsd.org/tutorials/how_to_use_wpa_supplicant/ Failure at first boot => fdisk (disk names)

OpenBSD Installation notes Accoutrements… Install with X and xenodm for desktop (6.4 defaults to fvwm) To list HDD/SSD/USB drives => sysctl hw.disknames To list partitions of drive sdX, etc. => disklabel (e.g. disklabel sd1) For urtwn-rtl8188eufw (Rosewill Realtek rtl8188eufw) => firmware.openbsd.org/firmware-dist/urtwn-1.2.tar.gz => cp /dir/urtwn-1.2.tar.gz /etc/firmware/urtwn-1.2.tar.gz => cd /etc/firmware => tar zvxf urtwn-1.2.tar.gz => cp /etc/firmware/urtwn-1.2/urtwn-rtl8188eufw /etc/firmware/urtwn-rtl8188eufw => ifconfig urtwn0 up => ifconfig urtwn0 scan => vi /etc/hostname.urtwn0 ++ join "mynetwork" ++ wpakey "mykey" ++ dhcp => reboot (had zero luck with ifconfig urtwn0 down/up)
